intro: Youngia lalashanensis, commonly known as the Lalashan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are broadly ovate with serrated edges, and its flowers are yellow, typical of the family. It produces a distinctive seed head with pappus that aids in wind dispersal. Youngia lalashanensis is often found in meadows and rocky areas, thriving in temperate climates.
